meanings.sent1: The snake slithered ventrally along the ground.
meanings.sent2: The beetle moved ventrally under the leaf.
meanings.sent3: The acrobat somersaulted ventrally, amusing the audience.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree spread ventrally, seeking nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The fish swam ventrally, its silver scales glinting in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: In a ventral position or direction
meanings.sent1: The airplane flew ventrally over the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The lizard climbed ventrally up the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The toy car raced ventrally down the slope, to the delight of the children.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed ventrally towards the ocean, carrying debris along.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast flipped ventrally, landing gracefully on the mat.
